title: The Power of the Stora Rör Swimming Association and Other Local Institution
excerpt: Economist Elinor Ostrom believed in the power of economics to “bring out the best in humans.” The way to do it, she thought, was to help them build community.

title: Why Thieves Steal Soap - Priceonomics
excerpt: Stealing soap is almost as good as stealing cash.

title: ‘Just stop buying lattes’: The origins of a millennial housing myth
excerpt: Financial gurus want young home shoppers to stop complaining and cut back on small luxuries. But there are broader affordability issues at play.

title: The Behavioral Economics of Price-Setting
excerpt: Prospect theory proposes that when making decisions people use a reference point to frame prospective alternative outcomes as either potential gains or losses; when considering prospective gains, they are risk-averse and prefer certainty, but when considering prospective losses, they are risk-prone and prefer to risk the possibility of larger but uncertain losses.
